name: IIT Bombay
description: One of India’s best for placements — strong CS/ECE hiring. Branch-dependent: top CS grads get very high offers (domestic & international). Average/median varies by dept (median often much lower than CS averages). Internship & startup opportunities strong.
eligibility: JEE Advanced (through JoSAA). + meet category/document criteria.
housing: Fully residential for UG students. Hostel fees: ₹1,000–3,000 per year. Mess charges: ₹3,000–5,000 per month. High-quality medical hostel facilities.
scholarships: Government minority / caste scholarships, Merit scholarships, Fee reimbursements for eligible categories, Stipend throughout internship.
notes: #1 medical college in India. Best-in-class exposure in all specialties.

name: IIT Delhi
description: Very strong placements — CS/EE/ME recruit well; high recruiter presence (tech, consulting, finance). Department-wise averages vary.
housing: On-campus housing available with varying costs.
scholarships: Various government and private scholarships are available based on merit and need.
notes: Strong focus on research and innovation, with numerous startups originating from campus.

name: IIT Madras
description: Consistently strong; CS, ECE, ME placements excellent. Good research & internship ecosystem. Particularly noted for engineering research & industry R&D tie-ups.
housing: On-campus housing available with varying costs.
scholarships: Multiple scholarship options available for students based on different criteria.
notes: Known for its research park and strong ties with industry.

name: NIT Trichy
description: Very good among NITs — core & IT companies recruit actively. Average packages vary by branch (typical averages 6–12 LPA in strong branches). Strong regional industry links.
eligibility: JEE Main + JoSAA counselling (NIT seats allocated through JoSAA).
housing: Hostel facilities are available for students.
scholarships: Government and institutional scholarships available.
notes: One of the top NITs in India, with a strong alumni network.

name: NIT Surathkal
description: Among top NITs for placements — strong engineering recruitment; averages depend on branch (~6–12 LPA for top branches). Strong core engineering presence and good recruiter mix.
scholarships: Various scholarship schemes are available for meritorious and deserving students.
notes: Located on the coast, it has a unique campus with a private beach.

name: BITS Pilani
description: Strong placements, especially in CS/Electronics; good international internship & placement opportunities via active placements cell. Average packages depend on major (CS often significantly higher). Higher fees than public institutions, but strong brand & alumni network.
eligibility: BITSAT (institute entrance) or state boards + admissions rules.
housing: Residential campus with hostel accommodation for all students.
scholarships: Merit-based scholarships and fee waivers for deserving students.
notes: Known for its flexible curriculum and 'zero attendance' policy.

name: IIIT Hyderabad
description: Strong CS/IT placements — high average packages for CS & research-oriented programs. Many students place in product companies & research labs. One of India’s best for CS & research-focused CS degrees.
eligibility: Admissions via JEE Advanced / UGEE / institute-specific tests & interviews.
scholarships: Financial assistance is available for students based on need and merit.
notes: A top choice for students focused on computer science and research.

name: Jadavpur University
description: Decent placements especially for core engineering branches; strong reputation in Eastern India. Average packages vary widely by dept (~4–8 LPA typical; CS higher).
eligibility: West Bengal Joint Entrance (WBJEE) / JEE Main-based admissions.
housing: Limited hostel facilities, with priority for students from outside Kolkata.
scholarships: Various state and central government scholarships are applicable.
notes: Highly regarded for its strong academic environment and low tuition fees.

name: Lovely Professional University (LPU)
description: Mixed outcomes — some branches & top students get good packages; overall averages vary (often 3–6 LPA band). Good industry outreach & large campus placement drives but varied quality.
eligibility: LPUNEST and also accepts JEE Main/other tests.
housing: Extensive on-campus housing with a variety of room options.
scholarships: Numerous scholarships based on LPU's own entrance test (LPUNEST) and other criteria.
notes: Known for its large campus and diverse student population.

name: Chitkara University
description: Vary by program and campus; many students get campus offers from regional recruiters, averages often in lower bands (3–6 LPA typical for engineering overall).
eligibility: University entrance criteria (may accept JEE Main / university test / merit).
scholarships: Merit-based scholarships available for students with good academic records.
notes: Focuses on industry-oriented education and has strong ties with local businesses.

name: IIM Ahmedabad
description: Indian Institute of Management Ahmedabad is a business school located in Ahmedabad, Gujarat, India. As one of India's premier IIMs, it is consistently ranked as one of the best business schools in India.
housing: Fully residential program with on-campus dormitories.
scholarships: Need-based scholarships, industry-sponsored scholarships, and various other financial aid options available.
notes: Considered the top business school in India, renowned for its case-study method and rigorous academics.

name: IIM Bangalore
description: Indian Institute of Management Bangalore is a public business school located in Bangalore, Karnataka, India. Founded in 1973, it was the third IIM to be established.
housing: On-campus accommodation is provided for all students.
scholarships: A wide range of financial aid options, including need-based and merit-based scholarships.
notes: Located in India's tech hub, it offers great exposure to the corporate world.

name: IIM Calcutta
description: Indian Institute of Management Calcutta is a public business school located in Joka, Kolkata, West Bengal, India. It was the first Indian Institute of Management to be established.
housing: Residential program with comfortable hostel facilities.
scholarships: Various scholarships are available for students based on merit and financial need.
notes: Known for its strong finance faculty and alumni network.

name: SP Jain Institute of Management & Research (SPJIMR)
description: S.P. Jain Institute of Management and Research is a private business school affiliated under Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan. SPJIMR sits on a 45-acre campus in the western suburbs of Andheri in Mumbai.
housing: Hostel facilities are available for students.
scholarships: Merit-based scholarships and financial aid for deserving candidates.
notes: Offers unique non-classroom learning initiatives and a focus on social responsibility.

name: Narsee Monjee Institute of Management Studies (NMIMS)
description: Narsee Monjee Institute of Management Studies is a private deemed university located in Mumbai. The University also has campuses at Shirpur, Bangalore, Hyderabad, Indore and Navi Mumbai.
housing: Hostel accommodation is available, but can be limited.
scholarships: Limited number of merit-based scholarships.
notes: Large university with a wide range of specializations.

name: Symbiosis Institute of Business Management (SIBM Pune)
description: Symbiosis Institute of Business Management, Pune is a constituent of Symbiosis International. It is one of the top B-Schools in India.
scholarships: Scholarships are awarded based on performance in the SNAP test.
notes: Known for its vibrant campus life and student-driven culture.

name: Xavier Labour Relations Institute (XLRI Jamshedpur)
description: XLRI – Xavier School of Management is a private business school run by the Society of Jesus in Jamshedpur, Jharkhand, India. It is one of the oldest business schools in India.
housing: On-campus residence is compulsory for students.
scholarships: Several need-based and merit-based scholarships are offered.
notes: Highly respected for its Human Resource Management program.

name: Jamnalal Bajaj Institute of Management Studies (JBIMS)
description: Jamnalal Bajaj Institute of Management Studies is a private business school in Mumbai, India. It is the Department of Management Studies of the University of Mumbai.
housing: No hostel facility provided by the institute.
scholarships: Government of Maharashtra scholarships are available.
notes: Famous for its high ROI due to low fees and excellent placements in the financial sector.

name: Amity University (MBA)
description: Amity University offers an MBA program known for its industry-oriented curriculum and large alumni network.
housing: Extensive hostel facilities with various options.
scholarships: Merit scholarships for students with high scores in entrance exams and academics.
notes: A large private university with a focus on corporate placements.

name: ICFAI Business School (IBS)
description: IBS has multiple campuses across India and is known for its case-study based learning approach for its MBA/PGPM programs.
housing: Hostel facilities are available at most campuses.
scholarships: Scholarships are offered based on IBSAT test scores and academic performance.
notes: Focuses on a case-based method of teaching to provide practical business knowledge.

name: AIIMS Delhi
description: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Delhi is a globally recognized medical college and hospital. It is the most sought-after medical college in India.
eligibility: NEET UG / INI CET Rank (Top 50-100 AIR for open category)
housing: Fully residential for UG students. Hostel fees: ₹1,000–3,000 per year. Mess charges: ₹3,000–5,000 per month.
scholarships: Government minority/caste scholarships, Merit scholarships, Fee reimbursements for eligible categories, Stipend throughout internship.
notes: Attached to India’s largest tertiary care hospital, offering exceptional clinical training. AIIMS students have highest success rates in PG entrance exams.

name: Christian Medical College (CMC Vellore)
description: Christian Medical College, Vellore is a private, minority-run medical school, hospital and research institute. It is a top-ranked medical institution in India.
scholarships: Huge need-based support, Christian minority scholarships, Fee subsidy for students in service bonds.
notes: Top-notch academics + discipline. Strong for surgery, pediatrics, medicine, neurology. One of the most affordable private colleges due to its charitable model.

name: Armed Forces Medical College (AFMC Pune)
description: The Armed Forces Medical College is a medical college in Pune, India, in the state of Maharashtra. The college is managed by the Indian Armed Forces.
eligibility: NEET-UG + AFMC screening test + medical fitness. Mandatory service bond in Armed Forces after MBBS.
housing: Fully residential. Hostel fees extremely low. Mess well-maintained (military-run).
scholarships: Almost entire course cost subsidized. Stipends available. Free medical coverage.
notes: Best for students wanting a military medical career. Guaranteed job after graduation with military salary and facilities.

name: Kasturba Medical College (KMC Manipal)
description: Kasturba Medical College, Manipal and Kasturba Medical College, Mangalore, together known as KMC, are two private medical colleges in coastal Karnataka, India.
housing: Hostel: ₹80,000–1.4 lakh per year. Mess extra: ₹3–5k/month.
scholarships: Limited merit scholarships, Few need-based options, Some international scholarships.
notes: Premium private medical college with strong global recognition. Students pursue NEET-PG / USMLE / PLAB with good success.

name: Jawaharlal Institute of Postgraduate Medical Education & Research (JIPMER)
description: Jawaharlal Institute of Postgraduate Medical Education and Research is a medical school located at Pondicherry, the capital of the Union Territory of Puducherry, in India.
scholarships: Government scholarships, Institute merit scholarships, Stipend for internships.
notes: Often ranked just behind AIIMS. Very strong clinical exposure due to tertiary hospital with huge patient numbers.

name: Maulana Azad Medical College (MAMC Delhi)
description: Maulana Azad Medical College is a medical college in New Delhi, India affiliated to University of Delhi and run by the Delhi government.
housing: Hostels: ₹3–5k per year. Mess around ₹3k–5k per month.
scholarships: State & central govt scholarships. EWS/SC/ST fee concessions.
notes: Considered one of the best govt. medical colleges in India. Attached to LNJP & GB Pant hospitals — extremely busy hospitals with the best trauma & medicine exposure after AIIMS.

name: Grant Medical College (Mumbai)
description: Grant Government Medical College, Mumbai is a public medical college, affixed to the J. J. Group of Hospitals in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India.
housing: On-campus hostels but limited. Hostel: ~₹20k–40k per year. Mess separate.
scholarships: Govt scholarships, Minority scholarships, Need-based.
notes: Very strong for surgery & internal medicine training. Attached to JJ Hospital (one of India’s largest) with high patient footfall.

name: King George’s Medical University (KGMU Lucknow)
description: King George's Medical University, is a medical school, hospital, and medical university located in Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh, India.
scholarships: UP govt scholarships, Merit awards.
notes: Good balance of affordability + quality. Excellent clinical exposure, best in Uttar Pradesh region with very high OPD footfall.

name: DY Patil Medical College
description: DY Patil group has several private medical colleges across Maharashtra, known for modern infrastructure but with higher tuition fees.
scholarships: Limited to merit & need; private so fewer options.
notes: High fees, moderate training quality, good infrastructure. Clinical exposure varies by campus, with Pune/Navi Mumbai being decent.

name: Dr. D.Y. Patil Vidyapeeth, Pune / Navi Mumbai (Private MBBS)
description: A deemed university in Pune and Navi Mumbai, offering various health science courses with a focus on private medical education.
housing: Hostel: ₹90k–1.2 lakh per year. Mess billed separately.
scholarships: Limited merit-based. Private universities rarely offer full scholarships.
notes: Best suited for students who want comfortable campus life and can afford private fees. Navi Mumbai campus generally stronger for clinical exposure.

name: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
description: A private research university in Cambridge, Massachusetts, MIT is a world leader in science and technology.
eligibility: SAT/ACT (optional, but strong scores help), GPA: 3.9–4.0 typical, Strong STEM background, Exceptional projects/research, TOEFL/IELTS for non-native speakers.
scholarships: Need-based full funding available. No merit scholarships (but aid extremely generous).
notes: Best engineering school globally in most rankings. World-class labs (CSAIl, Media Lab), startup accelerator, dedicated international support office.

name: Stanford University
description: Located in the heart of Silicon Valley, Stanford is renowned for its entrepreneurial spirit and engineering programs.
eligibility: Top 1–2% students, SAT/ACT optional, Strong research/projects, TOEFL/IELTS required.
scholarships: Need-based. Full funding possible for low-income students.
notes: Best for CS, AI, Robotics, EE. Recruiters from all Silicon Valley giants (Meta, Google, Nvidia, etc.).

name: University of Cambridge
description: One of the world's oldest and most prestigious universities, offering a rigorous and historic engineering program.
eligibility: A-levels with AAA in math/physics, SAT/ACT (for some intl students), Interview required, IELTS 7.0+.
scholarships: Cambridge Trust Scholarships, College-based awards.
notes: Very rigorous; globally elite reputation. Strong EU/UK placements.

name: University of Toronto
description: Canada's top-ranked university, offering a diverse range of engineering specializations and a vibrant city life.
scholarships: Various scholarships for international students.
notes: One of Canada’s most competitive engineering schools. Great for AI, CS, Robotics. Co-op jobs available.

name: Georgia Institute of Technology (Georgia Tech)
description: A public research university and institute of technology in Atlanta, Georgia. It has a strong focus on co-op programs and research.
eligibility: SAT/ACT recommended, GPA 3.8+, Strong math background.
scholarships: Limited for international students.
notes: Very strong for CS / aerospace / mechanical. Average starting salary: $75,000–$90,000.

name: ETH Zürich
description: A science, technology, engineering, and mathematics university in Zürich, Switzerland. It's one of the leading universities in the world.
eligibility: Very strong academics, German proficiency sometimes required, High math/physics scores.
scholarships: Some scholarships available for excellent students.
notes: Extremely low tuition fees. Great research exposure. Strong robotics and engineering outcomes.

name: University of Melbourne
description: Australia's top university, known for its comprehensive curriculum and research-intensive environment.
scholarships: Available for international students.
notes: Good engineering placements with average package of AUD $70,000+.

name: Imperial College London
description: A public research university in London, specializing in science, engineering, medicine, and business.
scholarships: Various scholarships based on merit.
notes: Excellent tech/science jobs and strong London industry exposure.

name: University of Hertfordshire
description: A modern public university in Hertfordshire, UK, known for its strong links with industry and a practical approach to teaching.
scholarships: Available for international students.
notes: Good for basic engineering roles with lower salaries vs Russell Group universities.

name: De Montfort University
description: A public university in Leicester, England, offering a range of creative and technical courses with a focus on employability.
scholarships: International student scholarships available.
notes: Moderate placement outcomes. Good support for international students.

name: Harvard Business School (HBS)
description: The graduate business school of Harvard University, consistently ranked among the top business schools in the world.
eligibility: GMAT 730+, GPA 3.7+, Strong work experience, Essays + recommendations.
scholarships: Need-based; generous awards.
notes: Average salary: $160,000 base. Consulting/finance dominate placements.

name: The Wharton School
description: The business school of the University of Pennsylvania, renowned for its finance program and broad curriculum.
scholarships: Available based on merit and need.
notes: Highest finance salaries globally. Avg base salary: $160,000–170,000.

name: INSEAD
description: A graduate business school with locations in Europe (Fontainebleau, France), Asia (Singapore), and the Middle East (Abu Dhabi). Known for its one-year MBA program.
eligibility: GMAT 700+, Very international profile, 2–5 years work experience minimum.
scholarships: Multiple scholarships available.
notes: Very strong consulting placement. Avg salary: €105,000–120,000.

name: London Business School (LBS)
description: A leading global business school, part of the University of London, offering a highly respected MBA program.
scholarships: Various scholarships for international students.

name: Rotman School of Management
description: The business school at the University of Toronto, known for its focus on integrative thinking and leadership.
scholarships: Merit-based awards available.
notes: Avg salary: CAD $110,000–130,000.

name: Kelley School of Business
description: The business school of Indiana University, known for its strong career services and collaborative environment.
scholarships: Scholarships and assistantships available.
notes: Excellent for supply chain, consulting. Avg salary: $120,000+.

name: HEC Paris
description: A leading business school in France, offering a range of programs with a strong international focus.
scholarships: Multiple scholarship opportunities.
notes: Strong luxury/consulting recruitment. Avg salary: €100,000+.

name: Saïd Business School
description: The business school of the University of Oxford, combining a historic academic setting with modern business education.
scholarships: Generous scholarship offerings.
notes: Strong tech, consulting placements. Avg salary: £70,000–90,000.

name: Coventry University (MBA)
description: A modern UK university with a focus on applied research and strong business links, offering an accessible MBA program.
scholarships: Available for international students.
notes: Mixed outcomes, with modest average salaries compared to top-tier schools.

name: Anglia Ruskin University
description: A UK university offering a variety of MBA specialisms with a focus on practical skills and leadership.
scholarships: International scholarships are offered.
notes: Decent for business/management roles, but in lower salary bands.

name: Harvard Medical School
description: The graduate medical school of Harvard University, a global leader in medical education and research.
scholarships: Need-based scholarships.
notes: Among the best in the world. Guaranteed high match rates for US residency.

name: Johns Hopkins School of Medicine
description: A leading medical school known for its groundbreaking research and patient care at Johns Hopkins Hospital.
scholarships: Financial aid available.
notes: Best for surgery, oncology, neurology. Exceptional match rates.

name: University of Oxford Medical School
description: One of the oldest and most respected medical schools in the world, offering a traditional, research-intensive medical education.
courses: Bachelor of Medicine, Bachelor of Surgery (BM BCh)
eligibility: BMAT required, AAA A-levels, Interview mandatory.
scholarships: Various scholarships for international students.
notes: Very strong employability in the UK Foundation Programme.

name: University of Toronto Faculty of Medicine
description: Canada's leading medical school, offering a top-tier education with strong research opportunities.
scholarships: Limited for international students.
notes: Highly competitive.

name: University of Melbourne Medical School
description: Australia's top medical school, offering a graduate-entry Doctor of Medicine (MD) program.
scholarships: Some scholarships available.
notes: Focus on graduate-entry medical education.

name: Karolinska Institute
description: A research-led medical university in Stockholm, Sweden, one of the world's foremost medical schools.
scholarships: Scholarships for non-EU students.
notes: Home of the Nobel Assembly.

name: Monash University
description: A leading Australian university with a highly-regarded medical program and a strong focus on research.
scholarships: Merit scholarships for international students.
notes: Offers a direct-entry pathway from high school.

name: University College London (UCL) Medical School
description: One of the largest and most prestigious medical schools in the UK, located in the heart of London.
scholarships: Several scholarships available.
notes: Strong focus on research and clinical practice.

name: University of Debrecen
description: A popular choice for international students in Hungary, offering medical programs in English with more accessible entry requirements.
eligibility: Entrance Exam, High School Diploma, IELTS 6.0.
scholarships: Limited scholarship options.
notes: Very popular among Indian students for its affordability.

name: University of Latvia Faculty of Medicine
description: An affordable option in the EU for medical studies in English, attracting a large international student body.
scholarships: No significant scholarships.
notes: An affordable entry point into European medical education.
